title: Ecosystems and Food Chains

vocab.definition: All the living and non-living things in an environment that interact with each other
The path that energy and nutrients follow as organisms eat other organisms
An organism that makes its own food, usually plants
An organism that gets energy by eating other organisms
An organism that breaks down dead plants and animals

teachingNotes: Use diagrams and real examples to show food chains. Discuss the flow of energy from sun to producers to consumers. Explore local ecosystems and identify the roles of different organisms.

sample.question: What role do producers play in a food chain?
